str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
